description: Observation to Borough of Camden for submission of partial Reserved Matters of Access and Landscaping and details pursuant to conditions relating to the southern part of the Kings Cross Central site between the Regents Canal, York Way, Kings Cross Station and Pancras Way including the realignment of Goods Way, reconstruction of part of the Regents Canal Southern Walls and provision of visitor moorings, partial details of Canal Square and full details of Boulevard as approved in outline as part of the planning permission for a comprehensive, phased, mixed-use development of former railway lands within the King's Cross Opportunity Area (Ref. No. 2004/2307/P, granted subject to a section 106 legal agreement on 22nd December 2006). Matters addressed by this submission entail: Reserved matters conditions 3 (approval of reserved matters), 16 (urban design report), 19 (access statement), 20 (illustrative build out plan), 21 (construction timetable); Partial discharge of approval of details conditions 9 (landscaping), 10 (planting programme), 18 (earthworks and remediation plan), 23 (highways plan), 25 (enabling works), 26 (other structures), and 56 (programme for archaeological investigation); and Details to show compliance with conditions 12 (landscaping -ramps and lifts), 31 (parameter plans), 45 (drainage), 64 (spoil volume), 65 (spoil truck movements), 66 (infrastructure truck movements) and 67 (construction truck movements).
decision_conditions:
The majority of our views relate to the junction of Goods Way and York Way.  Our engineers are concerned about the southern arm of the junction, specifically:
- The swept path analysis shows that in order for an articulated vehicle to turn left into Goods Way, it will need to move into the second northbound lane (refer figure copied below).  This raises traffic safety issues for vehicles in the eastern northbound lane on York Way.  This should be looked at in more depth to ensure that safety issues are addressed.
- Further detail is required on the use of the site on the south-west corner of the junction.  There is a crossover proposed to be retained on York Way - we are conscious of its location in relation to the cycle lane and ASL and have concerns regarding cycle safety.
 
Clarification is also sought on the pedestrian phasing of the lights at this junction.
